paper_abstract: Cops & Robber is a classical pursuit-evasion game on undirected graphs, where the task is to identify the minimum number of cops sufficient to catch the robber. In this work, we consider a natural variant of this game, where every cop can make at most f steps, and prove that for each fa parts per thousand yen2, it is PSPACE-complete to decide whether k cops can capture the robber.
paper_title: Cops and Robber Game Without Recharging
